entry.title: What does "Price Category HF" mean?
entry.content:
Hello.

I would like to know the meaning of the item "Price Category HF" in the "BCPricingChanges" sheet in the file "Delta_S4CE_2502_2408_final_SAPNote.xlsx" attached to SAP note 3533745 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3533745).
What does this item "Price Category HF" mean?
Is it a notice of future price category changes?

Thanks and Regards
--
Masahiro Nagao

entry.title: Output tax field in the customer master.
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I have a question about output tax field in the customer master.

This is our partner system, I want to add another Dep City/Reg for tax determination for customer side.
(For example, Dep City/Reg in US)

But I can't find which data affects this field in the SAP Public Cloud system.

Kindly explain what do I need to do add new country column in the output tax field in the customer master?

Best Regards,

entry.title: Why do parked supplier invoices (doc. type, RE) not display offsetting-account or cost-object Asign?
entry.content:
Why do parked supplier invoices (document type RE) not expose offsetting-account or cost-object fields in any of the parked-document CDS views?

I am analysing the following parked-document CDS views:

• I_ParkedOplAcctgDocument – parked document header (VBKPF)
• I_ParkedOplAcctgDocPyblsItem – parked AP vendor items (VBSEGK)
• I_ParkedOplAcctgDocRblsItem – parked AR customer items (VBSEGD)
• I_ParkedOplAcctgDocGLItem – parked G/L items (VBSEGS)
• I_ParkedOplAcctgDocAssetItem – parked asset items (VBSEGA)
• I_ParkedOplAcctgDocItem – generic parked-item cube

For G/L-type parked documents (SA), I_ParkedOplAcctgDocGLItem shows the offsetting-account and cost-object fields correctly.
However, for parked supplier invoices (RE), these fields appear empty when reviewing the document later (e.g. in the journal entry).

Is this because SAP does not store offsetting-account or cost-assignment data for RE-type parked invoices at VBSEGK/VBKPF level until the invoice is actually posted?
If so, is there any CDS view that can expose cost objects for parked RE invoices before posting?

entry.title: Official Document Numbers do not appear in VAT Statutory Report
entry.content:
I have configured official document number for Bulgaria and when posting a billing document, in the journal entry screen in official document numbers i see that the correct number is generated.

But when running the vat statutory report , in the txt file i do not see the official document number.

How can we make the vat report use the official document number?

entry.title: FS813 – “Company code is not set up for OSS.”
entry.content:
Dear experts,

we are currently facing an issue in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (release 2508) during billing processing.
The system raises the following error:

 

FS813 – “Company code XY is not set up for OSS.”

The error appears when a tax code containing OSS-related fields (OSS C/R, OSS Procedure) is used.

At this moment, we are unable to complete the billing process, and we cannot identify any available configuration activity in Public Cloud that would allow us to maintain or adjust OSS-related settings for the company code.

 

Observed Behavior

  • The tax code is treated by the system as OSS-relevant.
  • During billing, the system checks OSS registration for company code SWAN.
  • Since no OSS configuration exists for this company code, the system stops processing with error FS813.

We reviewed all accessible configuration points (Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases, Tax Calculation Procedure, EU Code/Code settings, etc.), but none of them allow maintaining OSS registrations.
We also could not find any SSCUI, app, or CBC activity that would allow us to perform this setup on our side.

Could anybody please help us to understand how OSS registration for a company code should be maintained in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

Thank you.

Martina

entry.title: SAP AVC characteristics not able to remove from the class.
entry.content:
HI Team,

I Created one Characteristics and assign into configuration profile and class for the product ,now i want to remove this characteristics from class or want to edit value assignment for characteristics but getting 

Characteristic COSIDA_SOLDADA used in configurations with this class: no deletion

Procedure

To display a where-used list, choose Display class -> Environment -> Where-used list -> In configurations (enter characteristic name).

However, you can only delete the characteristic with Engineering Change Management.

could you please help me like how steps i need to follow if i want to remove .

entry.title: asset history sheet
entry.content:
Hello experts ,

Are you able to explain to us, what the difference between both Axis Properties "Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based" is in APP _: asset history sheet in sap public cloud .

 

 

I'm asking because I'm still trying to find the right way to present data in "Asset History Sheet". This report should include only active assets as well as assets deactivated within the reporting fiscal year.

 

The main deactivation ways are as follows:

  • transfer from Asset under Construction to a fixed asset & closing of an investment WBS Element;
  • scrapping;
  • sale to 3rd party;
  • sale between IC companies.

 

For all retirement types – aside from IC sale – the standard AHS-Report with "None" Axis Properties is quite understandable: only assets deactivated after the cutover for balance carryforward in mid-December are moved to the report for the new year.

But when it comes to the asset IC sale, there is a bug that we can't get trustworthy explained by SAP, for example: in the AHS for October '25, we still see lots of assets sold internally in 2023 (e.g. 20000245-0, 30002028-0) and in 2024 (e.g. 30000856-0, 60000928-0).

 

I thought that maybe another display ("Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based") could be useful.

Indeed, assets deactivated in previous years aren't shown there, but at the same time assets acquired and retired in the current year are missing there too, even if they haven’t been deactivated yet

 

 

 

The number of displayed columns is also limited in "Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based" displays in comparison to “None” and seems not to include those whose values are zero, e.g. missing important column "Net Book Value at Reporting Date" in the file for some IT equipment.

 

Is there any other possibility to solve the issue with presentation of assets deactivated in previous fiscal years (without manipulating the filters on deactivation date)?

entry.title: Missing "Payment details" tag in XML Facturae (public entity) - DRC SAP PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We are working in this XML: ?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><fe:Facturae xmlns:fe="http://www.facturae.es/Facturae/2009/v3.2/Facturae">

We were trying to send an XML file to FACe. The procedure is now correct, and we can download the XML file and upload it to the FACe website (Spain).

Upon reviewing and comparing the format (with an older version of the client's ERP), we discovered that the <PaymentDetails> tag is missing. This tag contains the bank details where the company wishes to receive payment from the public entity.

Do I need to configure anything else for this bank information to appear in the XML file? I couldn't find any information on this. I tried including the bank details when creating the invoice and also added a custom bank to a business partner's profile, but nothing worked.

I followed the step by step from this website information: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a624a4a6d1d8473eb95fb42660127cfe/93f1698548a14c09947d53fbc1c3423a.html?locale=es-ES&version=2502.500

Thanks for the help!

entry.title: Manage My Timesheet (F1823) – Why is it possible to record hours when CO period is closed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,


I’m working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I’ve encountered a behavior in the Manage My Timesheet app (ID F1823) that I cannot fully understand.
When I record hours in F1823 on a Controlling-related object, for example an activity that triggers a redistribution posting of type RKL, I see the following behavior:


1. CO period open
- The system correctly creates a CO document
- Costs are posted to the CO object


2. CO period closed
- The time entry is still accepted by the app
- No CO document is created (which makes sense because the period is closed)
- The CDS view behind F1823 still stores the recorded hours and activity without cost and without any CO document

I would expect the system to block the time entry in F1823 if the CO period is already closed, similar to what happens in on-premise environments or other processes that require immediate CO posting.

Does it make sense that users can enter hours in a period where CO posting is no longer possible, generating an incomplete record without any CO impact?


From my point of view, this behavior appears incorrect or at least inconsistent:
• The CDS ends up storing hours with no costs
• The user receives no error or warning
• The record is technically incomplete (missing the CO document)
Is this behavior standard and intentional in the Public Cloud? Or is it a misconfiguration, an unexpected system behavior, or even a known issue?


Specifically, I would like to understand:
1. Should F1823 allow time entries when the CO period is closed?
2. Is there any standard control to prevent this?
3. Has anyone else experienced this issue, especially with RKL postings?
4. Is there any SAP Note or clarification addressing this scenario?


Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

entry.title: Title: API for Supplier Master and Supplier Bank Account maintenance in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Title: API for Supplier Master and Supplier Bank Account maintenance in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition

Question:

Hello SAP Community,

I am working on an S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition implementation project and would like to know if there are APIs available for the following:

Supplier Master creation and update - Is there an API (OData or SOAP) to create and update Supplier Master records in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition?
Supplier Bank Account maintenance - If a Supplier Master API exists, does it also support creating and updating the Supplier's Bank Account information? Or is there a separate API for maintaining Supplier Bank Accounts?
We are planning to integrate with an external system and need to programmatically maintain supplier data including their banking details.

Any information about API names, API Hub references, or documentation links would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Missing Contract Type ORI3 in “Manage Condition Contracts – Royalties” for Scope Item 55I
entry.content:
I am currently trying to configure the 55I – Royalties Management scope item, but I am facing an issue with the availability of contract types.

I am implementing the 55I – Royalties Management scope item in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I noticed that the contract type ORI3 – Royalties Intercompany Revenue Recognition is not available in the app “Manage Condition Contracts – Royalties”.

The only contract types visible in Public Cloud are the supplier-related ones (ORS1, ORS2, ORS3, ORS4).

My question is:
Is the ORI3 contract type available in Public Cloud?
If it is supported in Public Cloud, is there any missing configuration to have the ORI1/ORI2 and ORI3 contract types available in the mentioned app (Manage Condition Contracts)?

Thanks a lot

entry.title: Accounting position text
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

I work with SAP Public Cloud, and I was viewing an entry that may come from a subsequent charge or a goods receipt, and when modifying the position text in the accounting entry itself, all G/L accounts except for 3* can be modified. Does anyone know why this is? I can't figure it out. (photo attached)

Thanks in advance. Best regards.

Juan Antonio Moyano
